alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 16 at 2:36PM MDT until March 17 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with locally higher amounts in the Sangre de Cristo mountains above 10000 feet. * WHERE...Northern Mountains. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire chains may be necessary if traveling through mountain passes. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Due to relatively warm temperatures, much of the snow will initially fall as a heavy, wet snow. This may cause abnormally heavy weight on rooftops and other structures at high elevations.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
